titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the United Daughters of the Confederacy Virginia Division Records, 1901-1949
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 21706
titlepage.author: Trenton Hizer

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: United Daughters of the Confederacy Virginia Division Records, 1901-1949

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Daughters of the Confederacy Virginia Division records, 1901-1949. Accession 21706. Organization records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. E. R. Perkins (21706), Richmond, Virginia; Mrs. C. W. Schaadt (21821), Richmond, Virginia; Mrs. F. J. Pease, F. J. (22283), Richmond, Virginia; Mrs. Langhorne Jones (22646), Chatham, Virginia; Mrs. James S. Moffatt (22756), Lexington, Virginia; Nellie Bosquet (23489), Richmond, Virginia; Virginia Division, United Daughters of the Confederacy (30521), Richmond.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Division of the United Daughters of the Confedery was organized on 21 October 1895 as the Daughters of the Confederacy in Virginia. On 1 July 1896, it became known as the United Daughters of the Confederacy, Grand Division of Virginia. On 20 May 1903 it became the United Daughters of the Confederacy, Virginia Division.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records of the Virginia Division of the United Daughters of the Confederacy divided into three series. Series I: Grave Marker Applications containing applications for markers for the graves of Confederate soldiers compiled by chapter and by locality, also including correspondence, rosters and histories of various Confederate regiments and companies, biographical sketches, reports, and other chapter papers; Series II: Southern Cross of Honor Applications for Confederate veterans and including lists of recipients; and Series III: Cross of Military Service Applications for descendants of Confederate veterans who served in the Spanish American War, the Philippine Insurrection, World War I, and World War II and including lists and correspondence relating to both the Cross of Military Service and the Southern Cross of Honor.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series II: Southern Cross of Honor Applications.
Series III: Cross of Military Service Applications.

scopecontent.p: Grave Marker Applications containing applications for markers for the graves of Confederate soldiers compiled by chapter and by locality, also including correspondence, rosters and histories of various Confederate regiments and companies, biographical sketches, reports, and other chapter papers.

did.unittitle: Albemarle chapter (Charlottesville) applications and rosters of grave markers, 1941 .
Anne Eliza Johns chapter (Danville) applications and rosters of grave markers, 1938, 1941 .
Big Stone Gap chapter (Big Stone Gap) applications, 1940 .
Captain B. F. Jarratt chapter (Jarratt) applications, 1932 .
Elliott Grays chaper (Richmond) applications, roster of grave markers, and history of the Elliott Grays chapter, 1933-1941 .
H. A. Carrington chapter (Charlotte Court House) applications, 1930-1931 .
Loudoun chapter (Leesburg) applications and roster of grave markers, 1930-1940 .
Petersburg chapter (Petersburg) applications and rosters of grave markers, 1933-1941 .
Pickett Buchanan chapter (Norfolk) applications and roster of grave markers, 1937, 1940-1941 .
Robert E. Lee chapter (Belle Haven) applications and rosters of grave markers, 1940 .
Scottsville chapter (Scottsville) applications, 1931, 1940 (one labeled Scottsville or Fluvanna chapter).
Turner Ashby chapter (Harrisonburg) applications and roster of grave markers, 1932-1940 .
William R. Terry chapter (Bedford) applications and rosters of grave markers, 1930-1941 .
William Watts chapter (Roanoke) rosters of grave markers, n.d. .
Wilkes Valley Guards chapter (North Wilkesboro, North Carolina) applications, 1939 .
Miscellaneous Confederate rosters, sketches of organizations, reports.
Sketches of battles and Confederate organizations.
Biographical sketches of Confederate officers and soldiers.
Miscellaneous correspondence, reports, sketch of Mahone's Brigade.
Civil War period letters and history of individual battles.
Series II: Southern Cross of Honor Applications, 1901-1940.

scopecontent.p: Southern Cross of Honor Applications for Confederate veterans and including lists of recipients.

Series III: Cross of Military Service Applications, 1928-1949.

scopecontent.p: Cross of Military Service Applications. 1928-1949, for descendants of Confederate veterans who served in the Spanish American War, the Philippine Insurrection, World War I, and World War II and including lists and correspondence relating to both the Cross of Military Service and the Southern Cross of Honor.
